title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી નાથ પધારીયા, ગયા તે ગઢડે ગામ<RHYME_211739>; 
દર્શન દઈ દાસને, વળી કર્યાં પૂરણકામ<RHYME_211739>.
gujarati.context:
After leaving their home, they arrived at a distant village; 
They saw the master and completed their tasks with ease.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
જન મળી જીવનને, વળી લળી લાગ્યા પાય<RHYME_211741>; 
નયણે નીર્ખી નાથને, હૈયે તે હરખ ન માય<RHYME_211741>.
gujarati.context: Life's journey is fulfilled when people come together; it's a precious moment that can't be measured or owned.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
દાસ મળી મહારાજને, વળી પૂછે છે બહુ વાલ્યમાં; 
કહો કૃપા કરી અમને, શી લીલા કરી વરતાલમાં.
gujarati.context: The humble servant approaches the king with many doubts; ask the mercy of us, what play will be performed in our lives.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
કેટલાં મનુષ્ય મળ્યાં હતાં, કરતાં પૂજા કઈ પેર્ય<RHYME_211745>; 
કેમ તમને જમાડતાં, પધરાવી પોતાને ઘેર્ય<RHYME_211745>.
gujarati.context: Many people gathered, performing worship and rituals; yet you were not pleased with them, having wrapped yourself in your own ego.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી પ્રભુજી બોલિયા, સહુ સાંભળજ્યો હરિજન<RHYME_211746>; 
ભક્તિ જેવી ગુજરાતમાં, તેવી આજ નથી ત્રિભુવન<RHYME_211746>.
gujarati.context: The Lord's words are only for the humble and the oppressed; devotion like that of Gujarat is no longer found in the three worlds.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
રાત્ય દિવસ અમ પાસળે, વળી ઊભાં રહે એક પગે; 
મૂર્તિ ન મેલે મીટથી, વળી મટકું ન ભરે દ્રગે.
gujarati.context: As the day turns into night, I stand firm at one point; A soulmate is not found in a fleeting meet, nor does it fill the emptiness.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
ગાતાં ગુણ ગોવિંદના, વહી જાય સર્વે જામની; 
કાય નહિ કીર્તન કરતાં, ભાવિક બહુ નર ભામિની.
gujarati.context: The virtues of the Lord are abundant, and all worldly wealth is but a fleeting joy; singing praise to Him brings no worldly benefit, yet many foolishly pursue it.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
અતિ દુર્બળ કળ ન પાડે, ફળ ફૂલ ખાઈ રહે; 
જ્યારે અમે જમ્યાનું કહીએ, ત્યારે જમ્યા છીએ એમ કહે.
gujarati.context: The couplet suggests that one's true nature and accomplishments are not recognized until they have passed away, leaving only their legacy to be appreciated.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
એક એકથી અધિક અંગે, રંગ છે સતસંગનો; 
એવા જનને જોઈને, આનંદ ઉમંગે અંગનો.
gujarati.context: In the presence of someone who is one-of-a-kind, their company brings joy and color to life. When you meet such a person, your happiness and senses are awakened.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે હરિજન બોલિયા, એને નાથ આંહીં તેડાવીએ<RHYME_211752>; 
એવાં મોટાં હરિજનની, ઓળખાણ્ય અમને પડાવીએ<RHYME_211752>.
gujarati.context: During that time, the untouchable cried out, and God himself will take care of them; such is the fate of great untouchables like us.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
મહારાજ કહે કોઈ મિષ વિના, એ કેમ આંહીં આવે વળી; 
હુતાશનીનો ઉત્સવ કરીએ, તો આવે એ સર્વે મળી.
gujarati.context: The king says that without a test or struggle, nothing of value comes; celebrate the festival of perseverance and then all success will come to you.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે હરિજન હરખિયાં, સાંભળી વાલ્યમની વાતડી; 
નાથ ઉત્સવ આંહીં કરો, તો ધન્ય ભાગ્ય ધન્ય ઘડી.
gujarati.context: When the outcaste is ready to celebrate, listen carefully to others' words; only then can you be fortunate and blessed with prosperity.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી ઠેરાવી ઠીક કર્યું, વળી સંત સર્વે બોલાવિયા; 
સર્વે દેશના સતસંગી, સંઘ લઈ સહુ આવિયા.
gujarati.context:
The summary is:

After settling down and making everything right, everyone gathered to discuss; all the people of the country came together with their associations to help.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
હતા હુતાશની આગળે, દિવસ દશવીશ વળી; 
સંત ને હરિભક્ત સર્વે, આવિયા ત્યારે મળી.
gujarati.context: As the moments pass and the day wears on, a devotee's thoughts turn to God. When the time comes, they will find their true self in His devotion.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
દર્શન કરી દયાળનું, સંત સુખ પામ્યા અતિ; 
પ્રસન્ન વદન કરી હરિ, બોલિયા પ્રાણપતિ.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the joy and contentment that comes from beholding God's majesty and speaking to Him with a grateful heart. The speaker has found solace in their conversation with God, feeling blessed by His presence.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
અમે તેડાવ્યા તમને, તે પૂન્યમ મોર્યે દન પાંચમે; 
વહેલા આવ્યા દિન વીશ આડે, તેનું વિચાર્યું નહિ તમે.
gujarati.context: We have given you the pangs of separation, which will end only after many days; but you don't even think about it.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
ભલું તમે ભલે આવ્યા, હવે રહો સહુ રાજી થઈ; 
યાં તો પુરું પાડશે પણ, બીજે આવું કરવું નહિ.
gujarati.context: You have arrived well and now stay with me in peace; but don't assume you'll always get what you want, even if I give my word.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી કરી રસોઈ ચાલતી, પીરસે પોતે પંગત્યમાં; 
જમે જન મગન થઈ, આપે હરિ આરત્યમાં.
gujarati.context: After completing one's duties, one finds pleasure in one's own company; and having achieved that, one becomes one with the divine.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
ભોજન કરી ભાત્ય ભાત્યનાં, વળી શાક પાક સોયામણાં; 
દૂધ દહીં દિયે દોવટે, આદાં કેરીનાં આથણાં.
gujarati.context: Food shared with friends is enjoyed again and again; gifts of milk, ghee, and sweets are reciprocated with similar favors.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
બેસે પૂરા પાંચસે, પરમહંસની પંગતિ; 
જેમ જેમ ઝાઝું જમે, તેમ અલબેલો રાજી અતિ.
gujarati.context: As the sun sets completely and fully, so does one's ego; just as a moth is consumed by the flame, so too is one bound to fate.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
એક એકથી અધિક અધિક, રસોઈ રૂડી કરે; 
સુંદર પાક પંગત્યમાં, નિત્ય પ્રત્યે નવલા ફરે.
gujarati.context: As one's good deeds increase, so does their joy; in a beautiful garden of actions, every day brings new experiences.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
એમ જન જમાડતાં, વળી દિવસ વીશ વહિ ગયા; 
અભયકુંવર ઉત્તમે, તિયાં લગી સંત રાખિયા.
gujarati.context:
As days pass by like scattered seeds, memories remain with us; 
The great Lord Abhyakunvar has preserved the sanctity of that time.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી આવી હુતાશની, રૂડા રંગ રમવા કરાવિયા; 
કેશુ કેશર કસુંબો વળી, પતંગ રંગ બનાવિયા.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

After life's turmoil subsides, we start to enjoy colorful play; Our hair turns gray, but our spirit remains vibrant and bright.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
હરિ વિરાજતા હતા હિંડોળે, ત્યાં સખા રંગ આવ્યા લઈ<RHYME_211766>; 
નાખ્યો નાથને ઉપર્યે, પછી રમ્યાની છૂટી થઈ<RHYME_211766>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

God had created a beautiful scene in Hindol, where colours came alive; after leaving, it was as if they had taken flight.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
રંગ સોરંગ લાવે સખા, નાખે નાથને બહુ પેર્યે; 
અલબેલો થઈ આકળા, લાલ ચડ્યા લીંબ ઉપર્યે.
gujarati.context: Life's colors and sounds bring joy to the faithful, but for others, it's a futile struggle. The fleeting nature of life is like a flower that blooms only on its stem.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી જીવને કહ્યું જનને, આ રમવાની રીત્ય નહિ; 
કરો તડાં તેવતેવડાં, તો અમે પણ રમીએ સહિ.
gujarati.context: Life has told us to enjoy it freely; make the most of your youth, and we will also have fun with you.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી બાંધી બે મંડળી, વળી શ્યામ સખા સજ્જ થયા; 
ચાલે બહુ પિચકારિયો, લાલ ઢાલ આડી દઈ રહ્યા.
gujarati.context: After being rebuked, Shyam became aware of his mistakes; He then left with many regretful thoughts, carrying a heavy heart.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી ફાટુ માંડી ફેંકવા, ગુલાલની લાલે ઘણી; 
તેની ગગનમાં ગરદી ચડી, સોરંગ રંગ રાતા તણી.
gujarati.context: The passion and excitement of love is like a red rose that has bloomed in abundance; its beauty is as vibrant as the colors of the sunset.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
કનક કંઠી કોટમાં, વળી રૂડી લાગે રમતાં; 
રસ બસ થયા રસિયો, ઘણું સખાને મન ગમતા.
gujarati.context:
In the garden of life, relationships are fleeting like playing in a courtyard; 
True joy is found when one's heart resonates with another's, and they harmonize.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
વાજે વાજાં બહુ વિધ્યનાં, ઢોલ દદામાં ત્રાંસાં તિયાં; 
સ્વર ઉચ્ચે શરણાઈ બોલે, રૂડાં રવાજ વળી કાંશિયાં.
gujarati.context: The sound of a drumbeat is loud and numerous, but it's nothing compared to the turmoil in one's mind. The cry for help rises high, but the chaos within can't be calmed.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
સામસામા રમે રંગે, હારે નહીં હિંમત ઘણી; 
નિર્જર આવ્યા નીરખવા, રમત્ય જન જીવન તણી.
gujarati.context: Life's ups and downs are played out in various colors, but one's spirit remains unwavering; it is wise to observe the world's ebbs and flows while living life with enthusiasm.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી પ્રભુજી બોલિયા, જીત્યા સર્વે જન તમે; 
મેલો પિચકારી પાણિથી, ફગવામાં મળશું અમે.
gujarati.context:
God has spoken to you, and with His blessing, you have won over all the people; 
We will get wet in the torrent of love, and merge into it ourselves.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી જન રાજી થયા, જય જય શબ્દે બોલિયા; 
આજ પ્રભુને મળશું, તેણે તનમાં બહુ ફૂલિયા.
gujarati.context: After a while, people get used to it and start talking about it endlessly; today, I hope to meet my Lord, who has planted many flowers in me.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી નાવા કાજે નાથજી, ચાલિયા ઘોડે ચડી; 
સખા સંગે શ્યામળો, રમ્યા રસિયો રંગઝડી.
gujarati.context: After great difficulties and struggles, I have finally reached my goal; with friends by my side, I've enjoyed life's colors and beauty.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
ખૂબ ઘોડો ખેલવી, નાહ્યા પછી નાથજી; 
ગાતાં વાતાં ગામ માંહિ, આવ્યા સખા સાથજી.
gujarati.context: Life is a game of chances; don't regret what's lost after the fact. True friends arrive in your village, and they're with you through thick and thin.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
રૂડી રૂપાળી કરી રસોયો, જુગતે જન જમાડિયા; 
સર્યા મનોરથ મનના, ત્યાં લગી રમાડિયા.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a beautiful love story where two souls are united in marriage, their hearts filled with joy and harmony. In this union, they have found their purpose and are enjoying each other's company.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
પછી નાથ બાથ ભરી, ભેટ્યા સર્વે જનને; 
સંત સર્વે મગન થયા, સ્પર્શી જગજીવનને.
gujarati.context: After the storm, everyone's bath is filled; All saints have become like dust, and touch the very life of the world.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
અનુપમ ઉત્સવ કરી, ફરી શીખ આપી સંતને; 
સાધુ સર્વે ચાલિયા, રાખી રુદે ભગવંતને.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes a grand celebration honoring a saint, with the phrase "farī śīkh" indicating that the saint's teachings have been preserved. It concludes by saying that all the righteous people have departed (chāliyā), leaving only the Lord behind.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
અનુપમ ઉત્સવ કર્યો, ફાગણ સુદિ પૂન્યમ દને; 
કરી લીલા ગઢડે, તે કરાવી હરિજને.
gujarati.context: The festival of joy is complete, and the auspicious day of Phagun has arrived; with it, the humble Harin (untouchable) has also found happiness.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

gujarati.couplet:
જયા લલિતા જન મોટાં, સતસંગમાં શિરોમણિ; 
પ્રીત્યે વાલ્યમ વશ કર્યા, એની કહીએ મોટ્યપ શું ઘણી.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet:

People are great when they're in good company, and their words have immense value;
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 70: Nārāyaṇ Charitre Hutāshanīno Utsav Karyo

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Nāth padhārīyā, gayā te Gaḍhaḍe gām; <RHYME_1>
Darshan daī dāsne, vaḷī karyā pūraṇkām.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: The master of the divine has traversed the path and reached the village of spirituality; he has accomplished his devotional duties and fulfilled his vows.

transliteration.couplet:
Jan maḷī jīvanne, vaḷī laḷī lāgyā pāy; <RHYME_2>
Nayaṇe nīrkhī Nāthne, haiye te harakh na māy.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: In life, one should not be late for opportunities; and in the spiritual journey, one should not be fooled by maya (illusion).

transliteration.couplet:
Dās maḷī Mahārājne, vaḷī pūchhe chhe bahu vālyamā; <RHYME_3>
Kaho kṛupā karī amane, shī līlā karī Varatālmā.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context: The king of the servant (Dās maḷī) asks his wife about her happiness; she responds that she has been granted mercy and is enjoying a playful time with her beloved.

transliteration.couplet:
Keṭalā manuṣhya maḷyā hatā, karatā pūjā kaī perya; <RHYME_4>
Kem tamane jamāḍatā, padharāvī potāne gherya.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a person who is trapped in worldly desires and performs rituals as a means to attain salvation. Despite their efforts, they are still caught up in the cycle of birth and death.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Prabhujī boliyā, sahu sāmbhaḷajyo harijan; <RHYME_5>
Bhakti jevī Gujarātmā, tevī āj nathī tribhuvan.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: The Lord's words are like a gentle breeze that soothes the soul of a lowly Harijan. Devotion is the essence of Gujarat, where even ordinary people can reach the divine.

transliteration.couplet:
Rātya divas am pāsaḷe, vaḷī ūbhā rahe ek page; <RHYME_6>
Mūrti na mele mīṭthī, vaḷī maṭaku na bhare drage.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a busy day where time flies like leaves on a page. Just as a sweet image is not filled with sugar, life's sweetness is not filled with material wealth.

transliteration.couplet:
Gātā guṇ Govindnā, vahī jāy sarve jāmnī; <RHYME_7>
Kāy nahi kīrtan karatā, bhāvik bahu nar bhāminī.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: One's soul goes to the Lord Govind when chanting His name with devotion. Without spiritual practice, one's rebirth is uncertain and many lifetimes are wasted in ignorance.

transliteration.couplet:
Ati durbaḷ kaḷ na pāḍe, faḷ fūl khāī rahe; <RHYME_8>
Jyāre ame jamyānu kahīe, tyāre jamyā chhīe em kahe.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context: A distant dream can't be attained, while one enjoys the fragrance of a flower; The one who is eager to listen will find someone willing to speak, but the other remains silent.

transliteration.couplet:
Ek ekthī adhik ange, rang chhe satasangno; <RHYME_9>
Evā janne joīne, ānand umange angno.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: Each individual has their unique identity and color, which is enhanced by social gatherings. When people come together, happiness and joy overflow from every corner.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre harijan boliyā, ene Nāth āhī teḍāvīe; <RHYME_10>
Evā moṭā harijannī, oḷakhāṇya amane paḍāvīe.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: The Harijan's language is simple and honest, their Lord resides within themselves; their soul is pure like a lotus leaf.

transliteration.couplet:
Mahārāj kahe koī miṣh vinā, e kem āhī āve vaḷī; <RHYME_11>
Hutāshanīno utsav karīe, to āve e sarve maḷī.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context: The king says that without a mistake, no one achieves anything great; and in the festival of humility, everyone becomes equally happy.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre harijan harakhiyā, sāmbhaḷī vālyamnī vātaḍī; <RHYME_12>
Nāth utsav āhī karo, to dhanya bhāgya dhanya ghaḍī.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context: A poor person's wealth is their hard work and patience, which should be cherished. Celebrating one's poverty can bring good fortune and prosperity.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī ṭherāvī ṭhīk karyu, vaḷī sant sarve bolāviyā; <RHYME_13>
Sarve deshnā satasangī, sangh laī sahu āviyā.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context:
In this couplet, the speaker advises to go beyond one's own place and join a gathering of saints, where everyone shares their thoughts.

The saints' gathering brings people together in harmony.

transliteration.couplet:
Hatā Hutāshanī āgaḷe, divas dash-vīsh vaḷī; <RHYME_14>
Sant ne haribhakta sarve, āviyā tyāre maḷī.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context: The world is filled with chaos and noise, but the divine light of the saints can still be found amidst the turmoil. The pure-hearted devotees are like a ray of hope, shining brightly in the darkness.

transliteration.couplet:
Darshan karī dayāḷnu, sant sukh pāmyā ati; <RHYME_15>
Prasanna vadan karī Hari, boliyā prāṇpati.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context: The couplet speaks of the joy and peace that comes from a compassionate encounter with God, bringing immense happiness. It also mentions the liberation that occurs when one has a conversation with Lord Hari.

transliteration.couplet:
Ame teḍāvyā tamane, te Pūnyam morye dan pānchame; <RHYME_16>
Vahelā āvyā din vīsh āḍe, tenu vichāryu nahi tame.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: In a state of ignorance, I may excel in worldly pursuits, but it is still uncertain to others whether I am pure or impure. Others may understand me only after my last moment, which is far away.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhalu tame bhale āvyā, have raho sahu rājī thaī; <RHYME_17>
Yā to puru pāḍashe paṇ, bīje āvu karavu nahi.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: A person is considered good if they are honest and humble, not just because of their wealth or social status. Wealth and status may fluctuate, but a good reputation remains constant.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī karī rasoī chālatī, pīrase pote pangatyamā; <RHYME_18>
Jame jan magan thaī, āpe Hari āratyamā.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a situation where one's life is being carried away by fate, like a vessel on the river of time. Meanwhile, one's inner self yearns for God, seeking solace in His divine guidance.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhojan karī bhātya bhātyanā, vaḷī shāk pāk soyāmaṇā; <RHYME_19>
Dūdh dahī diye dovaṭe, ādā kerīnā āthaṇā.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: When sharing a meal, treat others with warmth and respect; offer milk and yogurt as a sign of hospitality.

transliteration.couplet:
Bese pūrā pāchase, paramahansanī pangati; <RHYME_20>
Jem jem zāzu jame, tem alabelo rājī ati.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that one's own self is like a treasure hidden in the distant corner of life, and as we move towards it, our worries and troubles fade away. Ultimately, one finds peace and happiness within themselves.

transliteration.couplet:

Sundar pāk pangatyamā, nitya pratye navalā fare.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context:
As each drop of love increases, the soul becomes more intoxicated; 
In this beautiful union, our lives become eternal and pure.

transliteration.couplet:

Abhaykuvar uttame, tiyā lagī sant rākhiyā.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context: The day of reckoning will arrive when one's deeds are weighed, and the path will reveal its true nature. Until then, a peaceful haven can be found in spiritual solace.

transliteration.couplet:

Keshu keshar kasumbo vaḷī, patang rang banāviyā.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a beautiful butterfly with vibrant colors and delicate features, which has been created by the divine artist's skillful hands. Its wings are adorned with intricate designs, resembling a masterfully woven tapestry.

transliteration.couplet:

Nākhyo Nāthne uparye, pachhī ramyānī chhūṭī thaī.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context: The color of the Lord's glory is reflected in the devotee's soul, filling it with joy. The Lord's presence shines above, while worldly attachments are left behind.

transliteration.couplet:
Rang sorang lāve sakhā, nākhe Nāthne bahu perye; <RHYME_25>
Alabelo thaī ākaḷā, lāl chaḍyā līmb uparye.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context:
When love arrives, it brings joy and harmony, just like the full moon shines brightly in the sky.
In love, even a small act becomes grand, just as the stars appear radiant above.

transliteration.couplet:

Karo taḍā teva-tevaḍā, to ame paṇ ramīe sahi.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: Life's journey is short and fleeting, so don't delay in living it fully. Make the most of every moment, as happiness is found only in experiencing it.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī bāndhī be manḍaḷī, vaḷī Shyām sakhā sajja thayā; <RHYME_27>
Chāle bahu pichkāriyo, lāl ḍhāl āḍī daī rahyā.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a playful scenario where someone (Shyam) has tied up a girl (Pachhi), and they're both enjoying each other's company. They're so caught up in their playful banter that they don't even notice time passing by.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: A gentle breeze carries the fragrance of flowers, and the night's beauty is highlighted by the stars. The sky's vastness is adorned with the colors of sunset, and the world is filled with joy.

transliteration.couplet:

Ras bas thayā rasiyo, ghaṇu sakhāne man gamatā.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the joy of being in love when words are sweet and tender moments are savored. It highlights the blissful feeling of being with someone special, where every moment is cherished.

transliteration.couplet:

Swar uchche sharaṇāī bole, rūḍā ravāj vaḷī kānshiyā.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the joy of listening to music and the freedom it brings, with every beat being a new experience.

transliteration.couplet:
Sām-sāmā rame range, hāre nahī himmat ghaṇī; <RHYME_31>
Nirjar āvyā nīrakhavā, ramatya jan jīvan taṇī.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: The couplet encourages one to enjoy life's simple pleasures and not worry about what others think, for true happiness comes from living in the present moment.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The divine lord has spoken, and all souls are yours to save; You are the ocean that quenches the thirst of all.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The couplet praises someone who has reached a state of peace and happiness, where they can rejoice in the joyous sounds of life. They have found solace with God and their soul is blooming like a lotus flower.

transliteration.context: Lord Nāthjī is busy with other things and has forgotten me, like a horse that's escaped from its stable; My friend Shyāmaḷo, in the beautiful garden of love, has adorned herself with the colors of passion.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The couplet describes the joy and bliss that arises from embracing one's true form and finding love, as if the entire universe has come together in harmony.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context: The celebration is extraordinary, and the offerings are pure. The divine play of Krishna is hidden, but it reveals itself to those who seek Him.

transliteration.couplet:

transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

The beloved Laila's beauty is boundless, and her company is radiant; Her love is so pure that it can transform even the smallest moment into eternity.
